intro: Lapsana aipetriensis, commonly known as the Caucasian nipplewort, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, oval fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
